exercises.title: Understanding Version Vowels
exercises.instructions: Choose the correct answer about version vowels in Georgian.

questions.question: What do version vowels indicate in Georgian verbs?

options.text: Whose benefit or perspective the action is for

questions.explanation: Version vowels indicate whose benefit or perspective the action is for - subjective (for oneself) or objective (for others).

questions.question: What does the subjective version ი- [i-] mean?
questions.explanation: The subjective version ი- [i-] indicates the action is for the subject's own benefit or perspective - 'for myself.'

questions.question: What does the objective version უ- [u-] mean?
questions.explanation: The objective version უ- [u-] indicates the action is for someone else's benefit - 'for others.'

questions.question: ვიწერ [vits'er] uses which version?
questions.explanation: ვიწერ [vits'er] uses subjective version ი- [i-], meaning 'I write for myself.'

questions.question: ვუწერ [vuts'er] uses which version?
questions.explanation: ვუწერ [vuts'er] uses objective version უ- [u-], meaning 'I write for someone else.'

exercises.title: Match Verb Forms to Versions
exercises.instructions: Match each Georgian verb form with the correct version type.

questions.explanation: Remember: ი- [i-] indicates subjective (for myself), უ- [u-] indicates objective (for others), and no vowel means neutral.

exercises.title: Version + Preverb Combinations
exercises.instructions: Identify the correct meaning of verbs with version + preverb combinations.

questions.question: ვდაიწერ [vdaints'er] means:

options.text: I will write for myself (perfective + subjective)
I am writing for someone (imperfective + objective)

questions.explanation: ვდაიწერ [vdaints'er] combines: ვ- [v-] 'I' + და- [da-] perfective + ი- [i-] subjective = 'I will write for myself.'

questions.question: ვდაუწერ [vdauts'er] means:

options.text: I will write for someone (perfective + objective)

questions.explanation: ვდაუწერ [vdauts'er] combines: ვ- [v-] 'I' + და- [da-] perfective + უ- [u-] objective = 'I will write for someone.'
